timeline.bodyText:
Using TimeUnit.MICROSECONDS.convert(Instant.now().toEpochMilli(), TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS) instead of millis * 1000 reduces the chances of ever making a calculation mistake when converting time values between different units.
Also: Using the actual current system time makes this test case depend on the fact that the local system time will not be lagging behind the time of the backend. I think it would be better to use a fixed time here as well, or at least add a negative value to the current local system time to reduce the probability that a small discrepancy between the two would make the test case fail.
timeline.author: olavloite

replies.bodyText: I see your point, but this test has been successfully passing in current format since always. Would prefer keeping it this way.
